Reviews.Title: “Ok but!”
Reviews.Author: Spikey1000
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in a school trip. Staff were ok (when available) the location is good and the nice. But the food was terrible and so were the cleanliness of the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great for Groups”
Reviews.Author: StevAus
Reviews.Content: Good value for money accommodation for groups. We use this hotel whenever we travel with senior high school students conducting site studies for History. Short walk to the S & U bahn, shopping centre (Gesundbrunnen) & restaurants. The hotel has a games room and internet facility which is great for the students, and the breakfast is very good. A short train trip and you're in the heart of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Simple Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrboajangles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as it was close to the starting point of an Undeground Tour we had booked otherwise we would have not picked this location. It had and industrial feel and we felt a bit unsafe. Hotel was simple and clean and breakfast was a simple european style buffet, nothing fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sorennedergaard
Reviews.Content: We stayed a family of 5 at this nice, clean hotel within 15 min of the center on the S and U bahn. It was great value, great breakfast for everybody and the staff was so nice, helped us out, ordered taxis and stuff. Service like a 4 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Decent one night stay”
Reviews.Author: dannyjayadams
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a stopover - convenient drive from the airport and good one night basic accommodation. Not so convenient for the city - it's necessary to travel but not so far with the tram. Good breakfast though...

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly satisfactory, no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: dyonysios
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in July. Its not a neighbourhood anyone would chose unless they had a reason to be in the area. That said its a quiet street, clean and close to transport links and a shopping mall. The reception was fine, clean modern decor. The receptionist was not rude as some have experienced. It may be a cultural thing, Berliners rarely greet anyone with a smile or indulge in any niceties, they are straight-faced and efficient and this is considered good service! The room was quite large by European standards. Its clean and the furniture is in good shape. Its Ikea style so all flat pack and MDF stuff but well maintained. Linen was very clean and beds (two singles pushed together to make a double German-style) are comfortable if a little soft. The ensuite batthroom while small is not cramped and also scrupulously clean. Breakfast is a cold buffet. Again functional but nothing to regret if you miss it. The dining hall feels a bit like a school gym or cafeteria. It does have a nice outdoor terrace with lots of lovely flowering plants so that will be nice in good weather (it was raining the two days I was there). Perhaps the only caveat is the soundproofing. Anyone talking in the corridor or opening a door sounds like they could be inside your room you hear it so clearly. And at this budget there are lots of families, mainly tourists from other parts of Germany or Europe so you hear the kids but its not like a backpacker hostel, no late night rowdies. Internet is fast and free throughout the hotel. There is a small bar next to reception that opens in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: bec0511
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this hotel and wish we stayed more! Very comfy hotel 4 stops out of the center of berlin, but very close to shops and stations. The staff were kind and helpful, plus it included a buffet breakfast. Great if you want a less expensive place to stay with some privacy, it cost us the same as a hostel in berlin with 6 beds!

Reviews.Title: “Crappy Staff”
Reviews.Author: doppeybird
Reviews.Content: This hotel is adequate in its facilities and has comfortable beds (although terrible pillows), but its location and the quality of its staff means that I would not consider staying at this hotel again. My mother, my friend and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and while it is close to U-bahn and S-bahn stations, the location in relation to places to eat or landmarks etc. is very weak. The staff was perhaps the biggest let down of this hotel, as not just one, but all staff members I encountered were rude and disinterested. The majority of interactions we had, I was not greeted with genuine eye contact or a smile, rather with dissatisfaction with me (when I would ask to purchase internet for example). Furthermore, we were laughed at when we asked if certain things would be open on New Years Day - turns out they WERE open! Perhaps if you were not used to staying at hotels and if you were with a large group of young friends this hotel would be worth staying at, but I will be going somewhere else if I come back to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location & breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Dennis347
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this clean, basic hotel. It was very close to the U/S-bahn station for convenient travel. The breakfast buffet was excellent. The only downside is that we had some car/train traffic noise in our room at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good tourist class hotel for cheap price”
Reviews.Author: BraveCougar
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel is great, in a quiet street 200 m from Gesundbrunnen station (S-bahn + U-bahn) / shopping mall. Staff is friendly, breakfast is good and rooms are basic but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and very well located - will be booking again next year!”
Reviews.Author: JoshRLondon
Reviews.Content: Me and my cousin stayed in the Citylight Hotel from the 10th until the 15th of August, we were in Berlin for a short summer break, and we both found this hotel to be absolutely brilliant, not too far from the central sights but far enough for it to be quiet and more local. The hotel is 5 mins from Gesundbrunnen U-Bahn and S-Bahn stations which has frequent and fast trains to the center of town, and is underneath the Gesundbrunnen Centre mall which was really nice - lots of good shops like H&M and a shop with DHL facilities for mailing letters home. The hotel itself is incredibly quiet, I wasn't woken up at night by any noises (except for the wake up call that I ordered, and got dead on time), the rooms are big with enough room to move, have a massive cupboard, large windows which can open slightly or completely depending on the weather, and all are very well designed and modern, and they are cleaned every day with the soaps/shampoos restocked each time along with fresh sheets and towels. The hotel has a fantastic breakfast spread, lots of meats, breads and salad, along with cereals, teas/coffees and was kept well stocked the whole time, I would have liked more of a hot choice but this is Europe, so it wasn't a problem at all. The games room has two pool tables, a big telly and vending machines for snacks, drinks and cigarettes as well as an indoor smoking room, which was handy because it was raining heavily outside. The bar is very well stocked, and also very cheap so that got used a lot! The staff are absolutely fantastic, really polite and very helpful even with my limited German. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone, and will almost certainly be coming back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for students”
Reviews.Author: alanbrown489
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Citylight three times in the past few years, every time with at least 45 A-Level students, aged 16-19 years on average. I would certainly recommend the hotel to anyone considering a College trip to Berlin. Its location for travel into central Berlin is excellent - an easy, short trip on the S-Bahn or U-Bahn. There are plenty of food outlets available nearby (chips, noodles, burgers - all the usual high-quality, nutritious intake that teenagers adore...), and the breakfast is more than adequate. I note that a previous contributor mentioned that his students were not allowed access to the bar. The reason for this is that kids can get extremely noisy, even when they think they are not being disruptive, and the simple remedy is to turn right out of the hotel and walk about 100 yards down the street to the 'Sheesha Bar' where they can drink, dance and chatter the night away if they want. As long as they re-enter the hotel quietly, there will be no problems. The area is safe, reasonably clean and not particularly expensive. Citylight is an excellent place to take a student group.

Reviews.Title: “Brill Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjaGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Definitely worth staying here. Basic hotel, but clean and good size family room (we had a room for 6, although only 5) Continental breakfast good. Games room downstairs - can play pool and table football. Staff friendly and helpful. Can reach the main centre of East Berlin in 10 mins by train. If returning to Berlin, then would definitely stay here again. Top marks !!

Reviews.Title: “Spartan but good size room and clean”
Reviews.Author: ChrisSussex_England
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, together with two friends, stayed for 3 nights in early December. In both cases the rooms were basically furnished but of a good size, with an excellent shower ,and were clean. Breakfast was in a large hall but one could eat as much as one liked from a continental breakfast bar. The staff were friendly and the reception personnel spoke good english and were very helpful. Location a little out of centre but within 5 minutes walk of good rail and underground connections.Overall very reasonable value for money. Chris O. Sussex ,England

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel A little Gem of a Place”
Reviews.Author: drhawk100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nites in November 2009,great hotel good location near s and u bahn stations [4 stops to down town] spotlessly cleaned and functional room with tv {CNN news channel in English] Very comfortable beds ,Wifi available at a small cost but Skype calls no probs regardless of payment. Small well stocked bar and a games room down-stairs. A fantastic buffet breakfast was included in the room cost with had both hot and cold options served from approx. 7.30 am to 10 am. The receptionists were very friendly and helpful and were able to get irail/bus passes from them We opted for the two day pass in zones A B C which was about 15 euros each but this ticket also gave a various discounts to attractions in Berlin .There are various restaurants and coffee shops on the nearby main street and a very good Italian restaurant just past the station They have a secure luggage room if you need to store bags before flying home on a late flight The only slight niggle was trying to find the hotel at night. A quick tip ,on leaving the station look for the green holiday inn sign and this hotel is just behind the holiday inn So basically get yourselves to the holiday inn walk past its entrance and take the first turning on the right and the Citylight hotle is tucked away on the right. I would definitely use this hotel again as it’s a little GEM of a place

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: siwoody
Reviews.Content: The rooms are basic but spacious and the beds are so comfortable! The breakfast spread is huge and delicious and the staff is friendly. Located a little out of the way, but close to mass transit, making it easy to get just about anywhere. A definite value!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely poor service, will not use again.”
Reviews.Author: slievenamon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a small group of art college students. There were 13 of us, 3 aged 25+, the rest 19-24, about half of us were students, the rest were partners/travel buddies). The purpose of our trip was to visit some art exhibitions and enjoy a bit of nightlife. It was NOT a structured school trip and this was made abundantly clear to the staff at check-in, in both English and German. From the moment we checked in we were treated rudely and with suspicion. The fact that couples were sharing rooms was queried - again we made it clear that everyone in the group was an adult and free to choose who they roomed with. We were handed a list of rules before we checked in - including things like "it is forbidden to climb from one room to the other via the balconies" - and eventually we were allowed access to our rooms. We had barely settled in for a nap when a room supervisor came in without knocking, muttered "Sie sind schon ins Bett" and proceeded to turn on all the lights and bang around the room, quite unsubtley checking us out and trying to see what we had brought with us into the hotel. The service deteriorated rapidly after that. Main complaints: We stayed 4 nights and not once were our towels or sheets changed. Our group was not allowed to use the bar facilities despite everyone being over 18 (16 is the legal age for drinking beer & wine in Germany) and despite this being one of the reasons we booked this hotel - so that we could have a drink in-house without having to search for a bar. The reason given was that we were a "school group" - they refused to accept that we were all adults even on production of our passports to prove our age (I am over 30 ffs) and even though there was a group of German schoolkids there all aged 17 who were being served without any problems at the bar. We were not rowdy, loud or intoxicated at any point of our dealings with hotel staff, so I do not understand this. The breakfast was fine but the evening meal was dreadful - pasta with sauce, dried out salad and left over fruit and yoghurt from b/fast for desert. We had booked an inclusive rate but most of our group chose to eat outside the hotel even though we had paid for dinner. This annoyed the staff no end and they complained that we did not turn up for dinner - seeing as we had paid for it surely they should have to prepare it whether we came or not? Despite complaining (in English and German) none of our concerns were dealt with. I have not yet received a response to my letter of complaint. Tip: if you're travelling with a young adult group, do NOT stay here. Try the IBIS hotels on Prenzlauer Allee, they are vastly superior and in a better location. For something cheaper, go to the Circus hostel. Citylight is only good for school groups aged under 14 that need ridiculous rules to keep them under control. I have never been so annoyed or insulted by hotel staff anywhere I have stayed in Germany or elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable value for money”
Reviews.Author: crazybeavers
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia for a very low price (37 € /night) which is much cheaper than most of the hotels in Berlin. It is basically a standard two stars hotel with everything you would expect from a hotel of this class. The room was very clean and quiet, service at the reception was very friendly and I was even let in four hours before the scheduled check-in. The breakfast room looks a little bit cold and not too comfortable, but I don't mind as long as the breakfast is good which it was. It is no luxury hotel, to be sure, but absolutely sufficient if you just need a place to sleep. And the value for money is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Citylights”
Reviews.Author: Pauldm21
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Citylight hotel near the end of Nov and was very impressed. Its in a good location about 15 minutes (3-4 stops) by train or subway from the city centre (Alexanderplatz, Freidrichstrasse, Hauptbahnhof etc) You can walk to the nearest station in about 2-3 minutes. The hotel is quite modern and immaculately clean throughout. Rooms are a decent size although our triple room was no bigger than a double/twin room with an extra bed squeezed in. Hotel staff were very friendly and always willing to give directions and tips on where to go. They even allowed us a late check-out on our last day free of charge! I'd say the Citylight is comparable to a Premier Travel Inn or Holiday Inn Express and therefore about 2-3star. It offers very good value for money and is an excellent base for exploring Berlin. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to metro”
Reviews.Author: Ellemic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Citylight hotel for 2 nights through a group tour and I must say the hotel was pretty good. The hotel is only a 5 minute walk from Gesundrunnen metro and probably another few minutes to Pankstr. metro. The room we stayed in was spacious despite a double bed in the main room and bunk beds on the side. The bathroom was clean and roomy. The view from the hotel is not the best but realistically who cares for 2 days. Breakfast was a surprise. The usual of srambled eggs, bread, cereal and also to my delight and surprise camembert cheese. The breakfast room is quite big as well. The people at the front desk were courteous and helpful in giving directions and there is also a bar on the side. If I was going back to Berlin I would definitely stay at this hotel. It is not central but if you dont mind going on a train ride for about 15 minutes to the city centre then this is the place to stay. Great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Big Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie18
Reviews.Content: I was a solo traveler and still got a huge room which was spotless. Great place, although the area could be a little questionable at night but was very safe in the day. Located outside the main city but what the heck, you have to take the bahn to get anywhere anyway. It was hot (around high 80s) when I was there and the rooms don't cool down until dark (around 10pm) so don't go here in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “arrogant kitchen personnel”
Reviews.Author: eyemdManila
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 days and 3 nights. Our initial impression of the hotel was that it is clean and cozy. Our room was comfortable with clean sheets, towels and toilet. Gesundbrunnen was the nearest metro station to the hotel (around 300 meters away). The area is safe. There was only one, as they say, fly in the soup… The day before our departure we requested the girl in the front desk if she could ask the kitchen if we can have an earlier breakfast at 6:30 am, the regular schedule being 7 am, for we’ll be leaving early. She did as we requested. She promptly called up the kitchen and assured us that they could accommodate our request. Believing that we can have our breakfast at 6:30 am as arranged, I gave my husband his medicines for his diabetes at 6:10 am the following day. We went down to the dining area at 6:25 am. We saw that man in charge of the kitchen arrive at 6:30. We waited outside the dining area but to our surprise the man in-charge of the kitchen stormed out of the dining area, glared at us and in a not so friendly manner said that he will serve breakfast at 7:00 am. We were caught by surprise at his attitude and tried to explain that we coordinated with the front desk and they said it was okay. He even ignored the front desk person! He was so consistent with his arrogance! We even witnessed how he growled at a poor teenager who was simply emptying the milk from her bowl of cereals! I don’t know how you could describe that kind of service to hotel clients! If you would like to pay and be treated in that manner, it’s up to you!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: cambridgegirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in February with 26 Year 11 students on a study trip. The hotel is near Gesunndbrunnen u-bahn anbd s-bahn so is in an excellent location. The rooms were incredibly clean and tidy and staff were well looked after. School students are looked after with good half board food and there is a basement 'youth club' room with sofas, table football and pool table to keep people amused in the evenings. would recommend for people on a budget or other school trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great value”
Reviews.Author: Pottie
Reviews.Content: A group of 4 of us stayed at the Citylight hotel for 4 nights and it was ideal for exploring Berlin. The nearest U & S Bahn stations are a 3 minute walk from the hotel, there is also a large shopping centre, restaurants etc as you walk out of the station. It took us on average 15 minutes to get to most of the tourist places by train. The rooms are a decent size as is the bathroom (no bath though only a shower). The staff were extremely helpful and friendly even though the hotel was full with 2 school tours. Breakfast is included and consists of cereal, fruit, yoghurt, cold meats and breads which is all you need to set yourself up for a day of sightseeing. You can also order a packed breakfast if you are heading out before 7am. They have a bar which is open 24 hours which also serves coffee etc. There is a games room which we didn't use and 2 PCs with internet which cost 1 euro for 20 minutes. CItylight was good value for money, it is not a luxury hotel but if you are looking for somewhere to sleep which is clean and convenient then you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and convenient to public transport”
Reviews.Author: OLPSFamily
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here for just one (Saturday) night and found it ideal. We had been having trouble finding one or two rooms for just one night in Berlin. We found the young staff to be both friendly and helpful. The rooms were big and clean. The breakfast room had a variety of foods to suit our fussy children! There was an Internet terminal near the breakfast room which we used with no trouble. It was not too far to walk from the Gesundbrunnen S-bahn station with all our luggage. We also liked the fact that there was a large shopping centre right opposite the station. The climbing centre across the road attracted our kids attention but we did not have time to check it out! It seems as though the hotel might be used mid-week by school excursion groups. If you are not looking for luxury but want good rooms at a reasonable price you should try this. The S-H family - Australia

HotelInfo.Name: Citylight Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Bottger Str. 23, 13357 Berlin, Germany
